title: 110_hr1944
content: The Act titled "Veterans Traumatic Brain Injury Treatment Act of 2007" amends Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, by adding a new subchapter for screening, rehabilitation, and treatment for traumatic brain injury. The Secretary is required to establish a screening program for veterans eligible for medical care to screen for traumatic brain injury symptoms. A report must be submitted annually to Congress detailing the number of veterans screened, prevalence of symptoms, and recommendations for improving care. The Secretary is mandated to establish a screening program for veterans to detect traumatic brain injury symptoms. An annual report to Congress must include the number of veterans screened, prevalence of symptoms, and recommendations for enhancing care. Additionally, a comprehensive long-term care program for post-acute traumatic brain injury rehabilitation will be developed and implemented by the Secretary at four designated polytrauma network sites. The program for brain injury rehabilitation includes residential, community, and home-based components with interdisciplinary treatment teams. Veterans eligible for care must have served in combat operations after the Persian Gulf War and be diagnosed with moderate to severe symptoms. The program will be implemented at four designated polytrauma network sites. The program for brain injury rehabilitation is for veterans who served in combat operations after the Persian Gulf War, diagnosed with moderate to severe traumatic brain injury, and unable to manage daily activities without assistance. The Secretary must report annually on the program's operation and the number of veterans receiving care. The Secretary must report annually on the operation of the traumatic brain injury transition offices established at Department polytrauma network sites for coordinating health-care and services to veterans with moderate to severe traumatic brain injuries. The Secretary shall establish a Traumatic Brain Injury Veterans' Health Registry to coordinate health-care and services for veterans with moderate to severe traumatic brain injuries through cooperative agreements with public or private entities offering neurobehavioral rehabilitation programs. The Secretary will establish a Traumatic Brain Injury Veterans' Health Registry to track veterans from Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom with symptoms of traumatic brain injury seeking care or filing compensation claims. The Registry will contain relevant medical data. The Secretary will establish a Traumatic Brain Injury Veterans' Health Registry to track veterans from Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom seeking care or filing compensation claims. The Registry will contain relevant medical data and notify individuals of significant research developments. The Secretary will establish a Traumatic Brain Injury Veterans' Health Registry to track veterans from Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom. The Registry will contain medical data and notify individuals of research developments. Individuals listed in the Registry must grant permission or be deceased. Subchapter IX of title 38, United States Code, includes provisions for screening, rehabilitation, transition offices, and a registry for traumatic brain injuries. The Secretary must implement these requirements within 180 days of the enactment of the Act.
